us.phonetic: /v. ˈsɛpəˌreɪt; adj., n. -ərɪt/, (v. sep′ə rāt′; adj., n. sep′ər it)

example.eg: The teacher separated the boys and the girls.
We had to separate the boys from the girls in class.
example.egtrans: 在班上我们得把女孩和男孩分开。

example.eg: The referee separated the two fighting players.
example.egtrans: 教练把两个打架的球员拉开。

example.eg: They are not divorced, but they separated a year ago.
example.egtrans: 他们没有离婚，但一年前分居了。

example.eg: Can you put the bread in a separate bag?
example.egtrans: 你可以把面包放到另一个袋子里吗？

us.phonetic: /v. ˈsɛpəˌreɪt; adj., n. -ərɪt/, (v. sep′ə rāt′; adj., n. sep′ər it)

example.eg: The twins look alike, but they are separate people.
Each division of the company is completely separate.  They don't even share a legal team.
The skirt and the jacket match, but they're sold as separates, not a suit.
At the airport the group will separate into those going to London and those bound for Paris.
Can you separate the good from the bad?
He was separated from the navy.

trans_examp.trans_cn: 遣散, 开除, 开除

example.eg: The chemical process separates silver from its ore.
The girl tried to separate the bad apples in the basket.

us.phonetic: /v. ˈsɛpəˌreɪt; adj., n. -ərɪt/, (v. sep′ə rāt′; adj., n. sep′ər it)

example.eg: Raw biodiesel gradually separates out and rises to the surface.

us.phonetic: /v. ˈsɛpəˌreɪt; adj., n. -ərɪt/, (v. sep′ə rāt′; adj., n. sep′ər it)

example.eg: A soil test separates out the different components and nutrients of the dirt in your garden.
This test will separate out the good students from the bad.

dsense.name: separate the wheat from the chaff, sort the wheat from the chaff

trans_examp.trans_cn: 区分优劣, 分清良莠
